Great image editor for my phone. Really appreciate there being layers. Just a fantastic program. Two suggestions that would be handy, if possible, is ability to resize the pixels to scale (so if I write '1000px' in the width box using the Transform tool, it automatically changes the height box number to scale). Another would be maybe having an option of a manual press zoom and move, so perhaps we can move and zoom with precision by touch tapping instead of less precise pinch to zoom. Thanks.

Pocket paint is a simple to the point image editor that does exactly what you wanted to do; It is one of the best apps of this niche in my opinion, however, that does not mean it is perfect. Pocket paint is quite rough around the edges, it crashes a lot and could be better optimized. Overall, even though my star rating may seem harsh, it is a big recommend from me if you are looking for a simple app to edit your images in.

Has potential, but not there yet. The 'Load image' option down-samples the 
image to a lower resolution and a new image has no option to specify the 
canvas size or output resolution. Needs a dedicated pan and zoom tool to 
save having to use gestures which is difficult when using a phone with one 
hand (including holding it). Colour picker view doesn't accurately reflect 
the chosen colour. Looks washed out. UI design is very nice though. Looks 
modern and easy to use on the whole.
Very good.
Suck

Honestly this is the best drawing app on mobile out there! One of the best 
things about this app is how you can zoom in close enough to see every 
pixel in the image which makes it quite handy for precise drawing. Also 
another great addition is how you can draw so easily using the tools this 
app has! This is hands down the best app for pixel art!

Don't know what has happened. I've used this app for several years, and 
loved it for it's simplicity, ease of use, user friendliness, and wide 
range of capabilities. For some reason however, I'm now having problems 
with it. Whenever I use the "Fill" function to put a transparent background 
in any sort of project I'm working on, it now force-closes on me. As I 
said, I don't know why it's happening now, because I've performed the exact 
same process countless times. I love this app, and I use the Hell out of 
it, so please fix whatever bug is causing this issue, so I can put my 
rating back up to 5 stars.

Garbage. I just wanted to draw some lines on photo, but this app loads it 
in tiny thumbnail size. I didn't find a way to load photo in full 
resolution despite fiddling with menus for 20 minutes, even new image from 
camera gives me pixelated thumbnail to edit instead of actual photo.
How do you get a smaller size of brush?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Press on the brush tool a second time, then you can select the size. Please try the new version.

The best painting app on Android. Love that you can zoom to pixels, then just colour single pixels, and the brush will go down to just a pixel. Love that you can load pictures as a stamp. Then place them on a larger canvas. All in all. You will not find a better painting program. Would like to see a small basic animation package built in. Simply draw the frames in Pocket paint. Simply import the frames, then play them. Keep up the good work.

This is a great and simple app for drawing and sketching. I wish I could have more layers and and maybe a quicker way to toggle to full screen but other than that this is a fantastic app. Many other drawing apps are too bloated with marking options. This is straight forward in mark making.
Great app! I wanted an app like Microsoft Paint. I'm delighted.
The auto zoom out kills it, I liked the line tool and the rectangle stamp, I can see how this can drive someone insane
Don't waste your time using this app, it's useless.
It's really easy to use and I make very good art on it
Screw all of you who don't like this

downloaded to make a "quick" edit for a meme -- I wasn't doing anything too complex but it ended up taking an hour and was frustrating the entire time. The fact that whenever you undo while zoomed in, it resets the zoom, is infuriating especially as the 'pinch and drag' zoom is finicky. The clone tool, which i was using the most so i could move letters around, is the most functionally useless piece of garbage that I have ever had the displeasure of handling. Whenever you touch it the wrong way it's either reapplying the clone or stamping the wrong thing everywhere (leading to those dreaded undos). Still 2 stars though, because I did end up finishing it the way I wanted and there are literally no other halfway decent photo manipulators on here
